Since the total area remains the same, we can set up the equation:

a² + b² = a × c + b × c

Factoring out c from the right-hand side gives us:

a² + b² = c(a + b)

Now, here's the clever part: we know that the sum of the lengths of any two sides of a triangle must be greater than or equal to the length of the third side (triangle inequality).
